bug.author: frankl1
bug.summary: Can't load the new french model : OverflowError
bug.description:
Hi I'm new to spacy and I'm facing some issues with the latest french model First of all the model failed loading after installation giving me a file not found exception, here is my trace
FileNotFoundError Traceback (most recent call last) in () 1 import spacy 2 ----> 3 nlp = spacy.load('fr_core_news_sm') /usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/spacy/init.py in load(name, **overrides) /usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/spacy/language.py in init(self, **overrides) 263 self.pipeline.insert(self.pipe_names.index(after), pipe) 264 else: --> 265 msg = "Can't find '{}' in pipeline. Available names: {}" 266 unfound = before or after 267 raise ValueError(msg.format(unfound, self.pipe_names)) /usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/spacy/language.py in create_vocab(cls, nlp) 40 @classmethod 41 def create_vocab(cls, nlp=None): ---> 42 lemmatizer = cls.create_lemmatizer(nlp) 43 lex_attr_getters = dict(cls.lex_attr_getters) 44 # This is messy, but it's the minimal working fix to Issue #639. /usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/spacy/vocab.pyx in spacy.vocab.Vocab.load (spacy/vocab.cpp:4742)() /usr/lib/python3.5/pathlib.py in open(self, mode, buffering, encoding, errors, newline) 1149 self._raise_closed() 1150 return io.open(str(self), mode, buffering, encoding, errors, newline, -> 1151 opener=self._opener) 1152 1153 def read_bytes(self): /usr/lib/python3.5/pathlib.py in _opener(self, name, flags, mode) 1003 def _opener(self, name, flags, mode=0o666): 1004 # A stub for the opener argument to built-in open() -> 1005 return self._accessor.open(self, flags, mode) 1006 1007 def _raw_open(self, flags, mode=0o777): /usr/lib/python3.5/pathlib.py in wrapped(pathobj, *args) 369 @functools.wraps(strfunc) 370 def wrapped(pathobj, *args): --> 371 return strfunc(str(pathobj), *args) 372 return staticmethod(wrapped) 373 FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/spacy/data/fr_core_news_sm/vocab/strings.json'
I correct that error by make the symbolic point on /usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/spacy/data/fr_core_news_sm/fr_core_news_sm-2.0.0 instead of /usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/spacy/data/fr_core_news_sm After that an overflow exception occured and here is the trace
OverflowError Traceback (most recent call last) in () 1 import spacy 2 ----> 3 nlp = spacy.load('fr_core_news_sm') /usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/spacy/init.py in load(name, **overrides) /usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/spacy/language.py in init(self, **overrides) 263 self.pipeline.insert(self.pipe_names.index(after), pipe) 264 else: --> 265 msg = "Can't find '{}' in pipeline. Available names: {}" 266 unfound = before or after 267 raise ValueError(msg.format(unfound, self.pipe_names)) /usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/spacy/language.py in create_vocab(cls, nlp) 40 @classmethod 41 def create_vocab(cls, nlp=None): ---> 42 lemmatizer = cls.create_lemmatizer(nlp) 43 lex_attr_getters = dict(cls.lex_attr_getters) 44 # This is messy, but it's the minimal working fix to Issue #639. /usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/spacy/vocab.pyx in spacy.vocab.Vocab.load (spacy/vocab.cpp:4974)() /usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/spacy/vocab.pyx in spacy.vocab.Vocab.load_lexemes (spacy/vocab.cpp:9653)() /usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/spacy/strings.pyx in spacy.strings.StringStore.getitem (spacy/strings.cpp:2470)() OverflowError: can't convert negative value to uint64_t
<denchmark-h:h2>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
Operating System: Ubuntu 16.04 Python Version Used: 3.5 spaCy Version Used: 2.0.3

comments.comment: Should be fixed now. Try again with the latest spacy-nightly.
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
